sense.name: Attack, encroach upon a space (as if) by military force
sense.examples: This new colleague invades my territory. The neighbors invade your privacy. Hitler invaded Poland on September 1, 1939. An army of insurance adjusters invaded San Francisco for the weekend.

sense.name: penetrate or assult as if living in/on a host
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[theme] INVADE NP2[location] NOTE: In this sense the invasion is not a conscious action. Location may be abstract.
sense.examples: The Kutzu plant invaded much of the South. The cancer had invaded her lungs. Mold invaded the bathroom. Every year, the waters of the Yangtze River invade inland. Frustration has invaded the team's spirit.
